html.p: Data Collection: WinEventLog:Security events from Splunk Add-on for Windows.

search.query: `cs_wineventlog_security` | head 1 | stats count | eval data=if(count>0, "Data Present", "Data Not Present"), label="`cs_wineventlog_security`" | table label, data

| makeresults | eval host_name = if("***"=="$tkn_host$","","host") | eval append_query=if("***"=="$tkn_host$","","join type=left host user [| search `cs_wineventlog_security` EventCode IN (4624,4648) user!=*$ | eval Workstation_Name=if(EventCode==\"4648\" AND Target_Server==\"localhost\",host,Workstation_Name) | where Workstation_Name!=\"-\" | stats count as no_of_logins by user Workstation_Name | rename Workstation_Name as host ] | fillnull value=0 no_of_logins")
`cs_wineventlog_security` EventCode IN ("4624", "4625") | dedup LogonType | table LogonType,Logon_Type

`cs_wineventlog_security` EventCode="4624" host=$tkn_host|s$ $tkn_logon_type$ ComputerName=$tkn_computer_name|s$ user=$tkn_user|s$ user!="*$" | `cs_human_readable_time_format(_time, event_time)` | table event_time, user, LogonType, ComputerName, signature, user_type

`cs_wineventlog_security` EventCode=4625 host=$tkn_host|s$ $tkn_logon_type$ ComputerName=$tkn_computer_name|s$ user=$tkn_user|s$ user!="*$" | stats count as "Failed Attempts" values(signature) as "Failure Reasons" values(LogonType) as "Logon Type" values(ComputerName) as "Computer Names" by user | sort - "Failed Attempts"

`cs_wineventlog_security` EventCode=4672 host=$tkn_host|s$ user=$tkn_user|s$ user!=*$ | stats values(privilege_id) as privilege_id by $tkn_host_stats$ user | mvexpand privilege_id | lookup windows_privilege_lookup privilege_id OUTPUT privilege as privilege_new | eval Privilege=if(isnotnull(privilege_new),privilege_id." (".privilege_new.")" ,privilege_id) | stats values(Privilege) as Privilege by $tkn_host_stats$ user | eval count=mvcount(Privilege) | sort - count | fields - count | $tkn_host_stats_appendquery$

`cs_wineventlog_security` TERM(EventCode=4673) host IN ($tkn_host$) | stats values(host) as hosts, values(privilege_id) as privileges, values(service) as services, count by user, process, status | eval status=status." (".count.")" | stats values(status) as status, values(hosts) as hosts, values(privileges) as privileges, values(services) as services, sum(count) as count by user, process | sort - count | fields - count | lookup windows_privilege_lookup privilege_id AS privileges OUTPUT privilege as privilege_new | eval privileges=if(isnotnull(privilege_new),privileges." (".privilege_new.")" ,privileges) | fields - privilege_new

index IN (wineventlog, windows, msad) sourcetype=Script:ListeningPorts host=$tkn_host$ transport=$transport$ dest_port=$port$ | fillnull value="-" appname | dedup host, transport, dest_port, pid, appname | `cs_human_readable_time_format(_time, event_time)` | table host, event_time , transport, dest_port, pid, appname

html.p: The appname field is available from Splunk Add-on for Windows v8.4.0 and later.

search.query: `cs_windows_firewall_status_logs` host=$tkn_host|s$ | stats latest(_time) as "Time" latest(Domain_Profile_Status) as "Domain Profile Status" latest(Private_Profile_Status) as "Private Profile Status" latest(Public_Profile_Status) as "Public Profile Status" by host | eval "Last Updated Time" = strftime(Time, "%+") | rename host as Host | table Host "Last Updated Time" "Domain Profile Status" "Private Profile Status" "Public Profile Status"

html.p: This panel looks for the latest status of the firewall on each Windows host. Regardless of dashboard timerange, this panel search the data within 24 hours time-range.

search.query: `cs_wineventlog_security` EventCode=4624 LogonType=RemoteInteractive host=$tkn_host|s$ | eval User_Domain = if(mvcount(Account_Domain)==2, mvindex(Account_Domain, 1), Account_Domain) | eval User_Name = if(mvcount(Account_Name)==2, mvindex(Account_Name, 1), Account_Name) | rename Workstation_Name as Source_ComputerName | stats count, latest(_time) as _time, values(*) as * by User_Name ComputerName | `cs_human_readable_time_format(_time, event_time)` | table event_time ComputerName User_Name count User_Domain Impersonation_Level Source_ComputerName Source_Network_Address | sort -evnt_time

`cs_wineventlog_security` ( EventCode=11724 OR EventCode=11725) host=$tkn_host|s$ | rex field=_raw "Product:\s*(?<product>.*?)\s*--\s*Removal" | rex field=_raw "(?<status>Removal\scompleted\ssuccessfully|Removal\sfailed)" | eval status=if(status="Removal completed successfully", "success", "failure") | dedup Computer product | `cs_human_readable_time_format(_time,event_time)` | table event_time Computer product user_id status | sort -event_time

table.title: Windows - End users tried to open CMD or PowerShell

search.query: `cs_wineventlog_security` EventCode=4688 "C:\\Windows\\System32\\cmd.exe" "C:\\Windows\\System32\\WindowsPowerShell\\v1.0\\powershell.exe" host=$tkn_host|s$ | `cs_human_readable_time_format(_time,event_time)` | table event_time ComputerName parent_process_name src_user parent_process_path CommandLine | sort -event_time

`cs_wineventlog_security` EventCode=5140 Share_Name="\\\\*\\ADMIN$" host=$tkn_host|s$ | `cs_human_readable_time_format(_time, event_time)` | table event_time Account_Name action app ComputerName file_name Message | sort -event_time
